original: Majjhima Nikāya 41
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Sāleyyakasutta
analyzed: sāleyyaka sutta
translated: With the Sāleyyakas

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena sālā nāma kosalānaṁ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena sālā nāma kosalānam brāhmaṇa gāmaḥ tat avasari
translated: Once, when the Buddha was wandering in the Kosalan country, he arrived at a Kosalan village named Sālā.

original: Assosuṁ kho sāleyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā:
analyzed: assosum kho sāleyyakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā
translated: The brahmin householders of Sāleyya heard:

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ sālaṁ anuppatto.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim sālam anuppatto
translated: “The ascetic Gotama, the Sakyan son who went forth from a Sakyan family, has arrived at Sālā.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: This is what is said about the Blessed One:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: ‘The Blessed One is an arahant, perfectly enlightened, accomplished in true knowledge and conduct, fortunate, knower of the world, unsurpassed leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, the Enlightened One, the Blessed One.’

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He, having realized this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—proclaims it, teaches it, proclaims it and teaches it, reveals it, makes it known, makes it plain, and reveals it.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ;
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing;

original: kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing; he reveals a holy life that’s utterly perfect and pure.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

original: Atha kho sāleyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: atha khalu sāleyyakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Then the brahmin householders of Salleyaka went to the Buddha.

original: appekacce bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce bhagavatā saddhiṁ
analyzed: appekacce bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce bhagavatā saddhi
translated: Some bowed down to the Buddha and sat to one side,

original: sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce🔽yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce bhagavato santike
analyzed: sammodisu sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce  yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appa ekacce bhagavato santike
translated: some exchanged greetings with him and, after the greetings and polite conversation were over, sat to one side,🔽some raised their joined palms to the Buddha and sat to one side,🔽some announced their name and clan to the Buddha and sat to one side,

original: nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce tuṇhībhūtā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: nāma gottam sāvetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce tuṇhībhūtāḥ ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: and some sat to one side in silence.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho sāleyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnāḥ khalu sāleyyakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: When they were seated, they said to the Buddha,

original: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yena m’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjanti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti
translated: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a plane of deprivation, a bad destination, a lower realm, hell?

original: Ko pana, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yena m’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: What is the cause, what is the reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, a heavenly world?”

original: “Adhammacariyāvisamacariyāhetu kho, gahapatayo, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hetu kho gahapatayo evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti
translated: “Householders, it’s because of unrighteous conduct, conduct not in accordance with the Dhamma, that some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a plane of deprivation, a bad destination, a lower realm, hell.

original: Dhammacariyāsamacariyāhetu kho, gahapatayo, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti.
analyzed: dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hetu kho gahapatayo evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: It’s because of righteous conduct, conduct in accordance with the Dhamma, that some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, a heavenly world.”

original: “Na kho mayaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāma.
analyzed: na kho mayam imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham ājānāma
translated: “We don’t understand the detailed meaning of Master Gotama’s brief statement.

original: Sādhu no bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetu, yathā mayaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, vitthārena atthaṁ ājāneyyāmā”ti.
analyzed: sādhu naḥ bhavam gotamaḥ tathā dhammam desetu yathā mayam imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena attham avibhattassa vitthārena attham ājāneyyāma ati
translated: It would be good if Master Gotama would teach us the Dhamma in such a way as we might understand in detail the meaning of his brief statement.”

original: “Tena hi, gahapatayo, suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi gahapatayaḥ suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho sāleyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho sāleyyakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ bhagavato paccassosu
translated: “Yes, sir,” the brahmin householders of Sallekha responded.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “Tividhaṁ kho, gahapatayo, kāyena adhammacariyāvisamacariyā hoti, catubbidhaṁ vācāya adhammacariyāvisamacariyā hoti, tividhaṁ manasā adhammacariyāvisamacariyā hoti.
analyzed: tividham kho gahapatayo kāyena adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hoti catubbidham vācāya adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hoti tividham manasā adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hoti
translated: “Householders, there is unrighteous and improper conduct in three ways: in body, in speech, and in mind.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ kāyena adhammacariyāvisamacariyā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo tividham kāyena adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hoti
translated: And how is there unrighteous and improper conduct in three ways in body?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco pāṇātipātī hoti, luddo lohitapāṇi hatappahate niviṭṭho adayāpanno pāṇabhūtesu.
analyzed: idha gahapatayo ekaccaḥ pāṇa atipātī hoti luddaḥ lohita pāṇi hata ppahate niviṭṭhaḥ adaya āpannaḥ pāṇabhūtesu
translated: There is the case where a certain person is a killer of living beings, bloody-handed, devoted to killing living beings, merciless to living beings.

original: Adinnādāyī kho pana hoti. Yaṁ taṁ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṁ, gāmagataṁ vā araññagataṁ vā, taṁ adinnaṁ theyyasaṅkhātaṁ ādātā hoti.🔽Kāmesumicchācārī kho pana hoti. Yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā
analyzed: a dinna ādāyī kho pana hoti yam tam parassa para vittu upakaraṇa gāma gatam vā arañña gatam vā tam a dinnam theyya saṅkhātam ādātā hoti  kāmesumicchā cārī kho pana hoti yā tā mātu rakkhitā pitu rakkhitā mātā pitu rakkhitā
translated: He takes what is not given. He appropriates with thieving intent that which is not given, another’s property, goods, or chattel, great or small.

original: bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sassāmikā🔽saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittāpi, tathārūpāsu cārittaṁ āpajjitā hoti.
analyzed: bhātu rakkhitā bhagini rakkhitā ñāti rakkhitā gotta rakkhitā dhamma rakkhitā sa sāmikā  sa paridaṇḍā antamasaḥ mālā guḷa parikkhittā api tathārūpāsu cārittam āpajjitā hoti
translated: He engages in sexual misconduct. He has sexual intercourse with women who are protected by their mother, father, mother and father, brother, sister, or relatives, who have a husband, who are protected by law, and even with those who are garlanded in token of betrothal.

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ kāyena adhammacariyāvisamacariyā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo tividham kāyena adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hoti
translated: Thus, householders, there is committing of offenses by body in three ways.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, catubbidhaṁ vācāya adhammacariyāvisamacariyā hoti?🔽Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco musāvādī hoti. Sabhāgato vā parisāgato vā, ñātimajjhagato
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo catubbidham vācāya adhamma cariyā avisama cariyā hoti  idha gahapatayo ekaccaḥ musāvādī hoti sabhā gataḥ vā parisā gataḥ vā ñāti majjha gataḥ
translated: “And how, householders, is there committing of offenses by speech in four ways?

original: vā pūgamajjhagato vā rājakulamajjhagato vā, abhinīto sakkhipuṭṭho: ‘ehambho purisa,
analyzed: vā pūga majjha gataḥ vā rāja kula majjha gataḥ vā abhinītaḥ sakkhi puṭṭhaḥ ehambho purisa
translated: Here someone is a liar. He is one who, in the settlement of lawsuits, is not worthy of confidence, is not considered truthful, and is not considered pure; he is one who speaks deceptively, speaks divisively, speaks harshly, and indulges in chatter.

original: yaṁ jānāsi taṁ vadehī’ti, so ajānaṁ vā āha: ‘jānāmī’ti, jānaṁ vā āha: na jānāmī’ti,
analyzed: yam jānāsi tam vadehi iti saḥ a jānam vai āha jānāmi iti jānam vai āha na jānāmi iti
translated: You can say what you know.’ So, not knowing, he says, ‘I know’; or, knowing, he says, ‘I don’t know’;

original: ‘apassaṁ vā āha: ‘passāmī’ti, passaṁ vā āha: ‘na passāmī’ti. Iti attahetu vā parahetu
analyzed: a passam vā āha passāmi iti passam vā āha na passāmi iti iti atta hetu vā para hetu
translated: or, not seeing, he says, ‘I see’; or, seeing, he says, ‘I don’t see.’ Thus, for the sake of worldly gain, honor, and service he deals in goods,

original: vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: vā āmisa kiñcikkha hetu vā sampajāna musā bhāsitā hoti
translated: buying and selling, bartering and trading, sending goods to be sold in distant places, and engaging in moneylending and agriculture.

original: Pisuṇavāco kho pana hoti. Ito sutvā amutra akkhātā imesaṁ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā🔽imesaṁ akkhātā amūsaṁ bhedāya. Iti samaggānaṁ vā bhettā, bhinnānaṁ vā anuppadātā,🔽vaggārāmo vaggarato vagganandī vaggakaraṇiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: pisuṇa vācaḥ kho pana hoti itas sutvā amutra akkhātāḥ imesam bhedāya amutra vā sutvā  imesam akkhātā amūsam bhedāya iti samaggānam vā bhettā bhinnānam vā anuppadātā  vagga ārāmaḥ vagga rataḥ vagga nandī vagga karaṇim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: He speaks divisively. Having heard a talk from here, he repeats it elsewhere to divide people against each other;🔽or, having heard a talk from elsewhere, he repeats it here to divide people against each other. Thus he is one who divides those who are united, a creator of divisions, who enjoys factions, rejoices in factions, delights in factions, a speaker of words that create factions.

original: Pharusavāco kho pana hoti. Yā sā vācā aṇḍakā kakkasā parakaṭukā parābhisajjanī kodhasāmantā asamādhisaṁvattanikā, tathārūpiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: pharusa vācaḥ kho pana hoti yā sā vācā aṇḍakā kakkasā para kaṭukā para abhisajjanī kodha sāmantā a samādhi savattanikā tathārūpim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: He speaks harshly. He speaks words that are rough, hard, hurtful to others, offensive to others, bordering on anger, not leading to immersion.

original: Samphappalāpī kho pana hoti. Akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī. Anidhānavatiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṁ apariyantavatiṁ anatthasaṁhitaṁ.
analyzed: samphappalāpī kho pana hoti akāla vādī abhūta vādī anattha vādī adhamma vādī avinaya vādī anidhānavatim vācam bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesam apariyantavatim anattha sahita
translated: He speaks falsehood. He speaks at the wrong time, speaks what is unfactual, what is not beneficial, what is not in accordance with the Dhamma and the Discipline. At the wrong time he speaks such words as are worthless, unreasonable, immoderate, and unbeneficial.

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, catubbidhaṁ vācāya adhammacariyāvisamacariyā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo catubbidham vācāya adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hoti
translated: This is the fourfold verbal misconduct in terms of action.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ manasā adhammacariyāvisamacariyā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo tividham manasā adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hoti
translated: “And how, householders, is there the threefold misconduct in terms of the mind?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco abhijjhālu hoti, yaṁ taṁ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṁ taṁ abhijjhātā hoti: ‘aho vata yaṁ parassa taṁ mamassā’ti.
analyzed: idha gahapatayo ekaccaḥ abhijjhālu hoti yam tam parassa para vittu upakaraṇam tam abhijjhātā hoti aho vata yam parassa tam mamassa ati
translated: Here someone is covetous. He covets the wealth and property of others thus: ‘Oh, may what belongs to another be mine! Or, may it be for another who is dear to me!’

original: Byāpannacitto kho pana hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo: ‘ime sattā haññantu vā vajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun’ti.
analyzed: byāpanna cittaḥ kho pana hoti paduṭṭha mana saṅkappaḥ ime sattā haññantu vā vajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesunti
translated: He bears ill will and an attitude of aversion, thinking, ‘May these beings be slain and slaughtered, may they be cut off, perish, or be annihilated!’

original: Micchādiṭṭhiko kho pana hoti viparītadassano:
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikaḥ kho pana hoti viparīta dassano
translated: He has wrong view and a distorted perspective thus:

original: ‘natthi dinnaṁ natthi yiṭṭhaṁ natthi hutaṁ, natthi sukatadukkaṭānaṁ kammānaṁ phalaṁ🔽vipāko, natthi ayaṁ loko natthi paro loko, natthi mātā natthi pitā, natthi sattā
analyzed: natthi dinnam natthi natthi natthi su kata dukkaṭānam kammānam  vipākaḥ natthi ayam lokaḥ natthi paraḥ lokaḥ natthi mātā natthi pitā natthi sattā
translated: ‘There’s no giving, no offering, no sacrifice; no fruit or result of good or bad actions;

original: opapātikā, natthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañca lokaṁ parañca🔽lokaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.
analyzed: opapātikā natthi loke samaṇa brāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imam ca lokam param ca  lokam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedenti iti
translated: no this world, no other world; no mother, no father; no beings who are reborn spontaneously; no good or virtuous recluses or brahmins in the world who have realised for themselves by direct knowledge and declare this world and the other world.

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ manasā adhammacariyāvisamacariyā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo tividham manasā adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hoti
translated: ‘ That’s how there are three kinds of mental misconduct.

original: Evaṁ adhammacariyāvisamacariyāhetu kho, gahapatayo, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: evam adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hetu kho gahapatayo evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti
translated: It’s because of misconduct in these three ways that some beings go to a bad destination, to hell, after death.

original: Tividhaṁ kho, gahapatayo, kāyena dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti, catubbidhaṁ vācāya dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti, tividhaṁ manasā dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti.
analyzed: tividham kho gahapatayo kāyena dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hoti catubbidham vācāya dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hoti tividham manasā dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hoti
translated: There are three kinds of bodily good conduct, four kinds of verbal good conduct, and three kinds of mental good conduct.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ kāyena dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo tividham kāyena dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hoti
translated: And how is there virtue and good habits in three ways?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.🔽Adinnādānaṁ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti. Yaṁ taṁ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṁ, gāmagataṁ vā araññagataṁ vā, taṁ nādinnaṁ theyyasaṅkhātaṁ ādātā hoti.🔽Kāmesumicchācāraṁ pahāya kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti. Yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā🔽mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā
analyzed: idha gahapatayo ekaccaḥ pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti nihita daṇḍaḥ nihita satthaḥ lajjī dayā āpanno sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī viharati  adinnādānam pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirataḥ hoti yam tam parassa para vittu upakaraṇa gāma gatam vā arañña gatam vā tam na a dinnam theyya saṅkhātam ādātā hoti  kāmesum icchā ācāram pahāya kāmesum icchā ācārā paṭivirataḥ hoti yā tā mātu rakkhitā pitu rakkhitā  mātā pitu rakkhitā bhātu rakkhitā bhagini rakkhitā ñāti rakkhitā gotta rakkhitā dhamma rakkhitā
translated: Here someone, abandoning the killing of living beings, abstains from killing living beings; with rod and weapon laid aside, gentle and kindly, he abides compassionate to all living beings.🔽Abandoning the taking of what is not given, he abstains from taking what is not given; he does not take by way of theft the wealth and property of others in the village or in the forest.

original: sassāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittāpi, tathārūpāsu na cārittaṁ āpajjitā hoti.
analyzed: sa sāmikā sa paridaṇḍā antamasaḥ mālā guḷa parikkhittā api tathārūpāsu na cārittam āpajjitā hoti
translated: Abandoning misconduct in sensual pleasures, he abstains from misconduct in sensual pleasures; he does not have intercourse with women who are protected by their mother, father, mother and father, brother, sister, or relatives, who have a husband, who are protected by law, or with those who are garlanded in token of betrothal.

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ kāyena dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo tividham kāyena dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hoti
translated: That is how there is threefold practice with the body in accordance with the Dhamma, in accordance with the Teacher’s Dispensation.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, catubbidhaṁ vācāya dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo catubbidham vācāya dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hoti
translated: “And how, householders, is there fourfold practice with the speech in accordance with the Dhamma, in accordance with the Teacher’s Dispensation?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco musāvādaṁ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato hoti. Sabhāgato vā🔽parisāgato vā, ñātimajjhagato vā pūgamajjhagato vā rājakulamajjhagato vā, abhinīto🔽sakkhipuṭṭho: ‘ehambho purisa, yaṁ jānāsi taṁ vadehī’ti, so ajānaṁ vā āha: ‘na jānāmī’ti,
analyzed: ekaccaḥ musāvādam pahāya musāvādā paṭivirataḥ hoti sabhā gataḥ vā  parisā gataḥ vā ñāti majjha gataḥ vā pūga majjha gataḥ vā rāja kula majjha gataḥ vā abhinītaḥ  sakkhipuṭṭhaḥ eham bho purisa yam jānāsi tam vadehi iti saḥ a jānam vai āha na jānāmi iti
translated: Here someone, abandoning false speech, abstains from false speech.

original: jānaṁ vā āha: ‘jānāmī’ti, apassaṁ vā āha: ‘na passāmī’ti, passaṁ vā āha: ‘passāmī’ti.
analyzed: jānam vā āha jānāmi iti a passam vā āha na passāmi iti passam vā āha passāmi iti
translated: When summoned to a court, or to a meeting, or to his relatives’ presence, or to his guild, or to the royal family’s presence, and questioned as a witness thus: ‘So, good man, tell what you know,’ not knowing, he says, ‘I do not know,’ or knowing, he says, ‘I know’; not seeing, he says, ‘I do not see,’ or seeing, he says, ‘I see.’

original: Iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā na sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: iti atta hetu vā para hetu vā āmisa kiñcikkha hetu vā na sampajāna musā bhāsitā hoti
translated: Thus he does not consciously speak falsehood even in jest.

original: Pisuṇaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā
analyzed: pisuṇam vācam pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti itas sutvā na amutra akkhātā
translated: Abandoning malicious speech, he abstains from malicious speech. Having heard something here, he does not repeat it elsewhere in order to divide those people against these,

original: imesaṁ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṁ akkhātā amūsaṁ bhedāya. Iti bhinnānaṁ vā
analyzed: imesam bhedāya amutra vā sutvā na imesam akkhātāḥ amūsam bhedāya iti bhinnānam vā
translated: for the sake of dividing them, or after hearing it somewhere else, he does not proclaim a division of the Saṅgha.

original: sandhātā, sahitānaṁ vā anuppadātā, samaggārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: sandhātā sahitānam vai anuppadātā samagga ārāmaḥ samagga rataḥ samagga nandī samagga karaṇim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: He is one who unites factions, who favours friendship, delights in friendship, who loves friendship, who speaks things that create friendship.

original: Pharusaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti. Yā sā vācā nelā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā—tathārūpiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.🔽Samphappalāpaṁ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti. Kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī
analyzed: pharusam vācam pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti yā sā vācā nelā kaṇṇa sukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahu jana kantā bahu jana manāpātathārūpim vācam bhāsitā hoti  samphappalāpam pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirataḥ hoti kāla vādī bhūta vādī attha vādī
translated: He has abandoned harsh speech and abstains from harsh speech. He speaks only such words as are gentle, pleasing to the ear, endearing, going to the heart, urbane, amiable, and agreeable to the many-folk.

original: dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti kālena sāpadesaṁ pariyantavatiṁ atthasaṁhitaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma vādī vinaya vādī nidhānavatim vācam bhāsitā hoti kālena sa apadesam pariyantavatim attha sahita
translated: He has abandoned idle chatter and abstains from idle chatter. He speaks in season, speaks what is factual, what is in accordance with the goal, the Dhamma, and the Vinaya. He speaks words worth treasuring, seasonable, reasonable, circumscribed, and endowed with meaning.

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, catubbidhaṁ vācāya dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo catubbidham vācāya dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hoti
translated: This is the fourfold purity of verbal action.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ manasā dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo tividham manasā dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hoti
translated: “And how, householders, is there purity of mind threefold?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco anabhijjhālu hoti, yaṁ taṁ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṁ taṁ nābhijjhātā hoti: ‘aho vata yaṁ parassa taṁ mamassā’ti.
analyzed: idha gahapatayo ekaccaḥ an abhijjhālu hoti yam tam parassa para vittu upakaraṇam tam na abhijjhātā hoti aho vata yam parassa tam mamassa ati
translated: “Here, householders, someone is not covetous. He does not covet the wealth and property of others thus: ‘Oh, may what belongs to another be mine! ‘

original: Abyāpannacitto kho pana hoti appaduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo: ‘ime sattā averā abyābajjhā anīghā sukhī attānaṁ pariharantū’ti.
analyzed: a byāpanna cittaḥ kho pana hoti appaduṭṭha mana saṅkappaḥ ime sattāḥ averāḥ a byābajjhāḥ anīghāḥ sukhī attānam pariharantu uti
translated: “He has a mind of loving-kindness without inner hate, and he has a mind of compassion without inner ill will, and he has a mind of sympathetic joy without inner discontent, and he has a mind of equanimity without inner restlessness.

original: Sammādiṭṭhiko kho pana hoti aviparītadassano:🔽‘atthi dinnaṁ atthi yiṭṭhaṁ atthi hutaṁ, atthi sukatadukkaṭānaṁ kammānaṁ phalaṁ vipāko,🔽atthi ayaṁ loko atthi paro loko, atthi mātā atthi pitā, atthi sattā opapātikā, atthi🔽loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañca lokaṁ parañca lokaṁ sayaṁ
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhikaḥ kho pana hoti a viparīta dassano  atthi dinnam atthi yiṭṭham atthi atthi su kata dukkaṭānam kammānam phalam vipākaḥ  atthi ayam lokaḥ atthi paraḥ lokaḥ atthi mātā atthi pitā atthi sattāḥ opapātikāḥ atthi  loke samaṇa brāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye iman ca lokam paran ca lokam
translated: “He has right view, undistorted view, thus:

original: abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.
analyzed: abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedenti iti
translated: ‘There is what is given, what is offered, what is sacrificed. There is fruit and result of good and bad actions. There is this world and the other world. There is mother and father. There are beings who are reborn spontaneously. There are in the world good and virtuous recluses and brahmins who have realised for themselves by direct knowledge and declare this world and the other world.’

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ manasā dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo tividham manasā dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hoti
translated: “This is the threefold mental good conduct.

original: Evaṁ dhammacariyāsamacariyāhetu kho, gahapatayo, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: evam dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hetu kho gahapatayo evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti
translated: It is for this reason that some beings, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, in the heavenly world.

original: Ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī:
analyzed: ākaṅkheyya ce gahapatayo dhamma cārī sama cārī
translated: Householders, if a virtuous person, a person of good character, should wish:

translated: It’s possible that, with the ending of the effluents, he might realize for himself with direct knowledge, in this very life, the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, and having entered upon it, dwell in it.”

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Tathā hi so dhammacārī samacārī”ti.
analyzed: tathā hi so dhamma cārī sama cārī iti
translated: Because he is one who conducts himself by the Dhamma, by what is right.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, sāleyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte sāleyyakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: When this was said, the brahmin householders of Salleyaka said to the Blessed One,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama  seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent!

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.🔽Ete mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito  ete mayam bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: in the same way has Master Gotama—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.🔽We go to Master Gotama for refuge, to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Upāsake no bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇaṁ gate”ti.
analyzed: upāsake naḥ bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇam gatā iti
translated: May Master Gotama remember us as lay followers who have gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Sāleyyakasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: sāleyyaka suttam niṭṭhitam paṭhama
translated: The Sāleyyaka Sutta is finished.
